TITLE: Fed Minutes Showed Officials Feeling Better About Inflation
SUMMARY: Central bankers wanted to signal that interest rates were likely at or near their peak while keeping their options open, December minutes showed.

TITLE: General Motors Reports a 14% Jump in U.S. Auto Sales in 2023
SUMMARY: The nation’s largest automaker sold more cars in 2023 than a year ago as supply chain chaos ended, but sales are now under pressure from rising interest rates.

TITLE: Will America’s Good News on Inflation Last?
SUMMARY: One of the biggest economic surprises of 2023 was how quickly inflation faded. A dig into the details offers hints at whether it will last into 2024.

TITLE: U.S. Awards Chip Supplier $162 Million to Bolster Critical Industries
SUMMARY: The Biden administration said its second grant under a new program would help Microchip Technology expand its facilities in Oregon and Colorado.

TITLE: Auto Sales Are Expected to Slow After a Strong 2023
SUMMARY: Automakers sold more cars in 2023 than a year ago as supply chain chaos ended, but sales are now under pressure from higher interest rates.

TITLE: U.S. Added 216,000 Jobs in December, Outpacing Forecasts
SUMMARY: Hiring has throttled back from 2021 and 2022, but was impressive last year by longer-term standards.

TITLE: U.S. Steel Acquisition Proposal Tests Biden’s Industrial Policy
SUMMARY: The president is under pressure from Democrats and Republicans to block the sale to Japan’s Nippon Steel, which could upset a key foreign ally.

TITLE: The Mystery of the Coin That Shouldn’t Exist
SUMMARY: Scientists recently analyzed a Peruvian 10-cent piece with an unexplained origin.

TITLE: World Bank Warns of Energy Price Surge if Mideast War Spreads
SUMMARY: A new economic report predicted a year of weak growth and said the world faced a decade of “wasted opportunity.”

TITLE: Democrats Question Semiconductor Program’s Ties to Wall St.
SUMMARY: Two progressive lawmakers warned the Biden administration against creating a revolving door between industry and government as it prepares to hand out $39 billion in grants.

TITLE: Mortgage Rates and Inflation Could Draw Attention to the Fed This Election
SUMMARY: The Federal Reserve is poised to cut rates in 2024 while moving away from balance sheet shrinking. Yet a key event looms in the backdrop: the election.

TITLE: As Utility Bills Rise, Low-Income Americans Struggle for Access to Clean Energy
SUMMARY: The Biden administration has deployed various programs to try to increase access to clean energy. But systems that could help lower bills are still out of reach for many low-income households.

TITLE: Trump’s Dominance and Snowy Weather Put Iowa’s Caucus Economy on Ice
SUMMARY: Republican candidates have spent heavily in Iowa, but the state is seeing fewer visitors, and winter storms have upended events and travel plans.

TITLE: Supreme Court to Hear Starbucks Bid to Overturn Labor Ruling
SUMMARY: The coffee chain has challenged a federal judge’s order to reinstate a group of union activists who were fired at a store in Memphis.

TITLE: Microsoft Tops Apple to Become Most Valuable Public Company
SUMMARY: The shift is indicative of the importance of new artificial intelligence technology to Silicon Valley and Wall Street investors.

TITLE: New U.S. Solar and Electric Car Factories Face Familiar Challenge: China
SUMMARY: Worries are growing in Washington that a flood of Chinese products could put new American investments in clean energy and high-tech factories at risk.

TITLE: A Fed Governor Reiterates That Rate Cuts Are Coming
SUMMARY: Christopher Waller, one of seven Washington-based Fed governors, said officials should cut rates as inflation cools — though timing was uncertain.
